SENT.plain: Symptomatic trigeminal neuralgia due to a brainstem infarction is said to be rare
However, facial pain is not uncommon in Wallenberg's syndrome
Facial pain related to a Wallenberg's syndrome may be either persistent of intermittent, and occasionally occurs in brief attacks
Here, we report a patient with a right lateral medullary infarction who started having first division trigeminal neuralgia 1Â month after the stroke
The pain paroxysms were suppressed with gabapentin
